body: Updated commit message, rebased PR.

Please check the commit message before commit.
Are the component versions in separate lines ?
It doesn't look like that me.

Tested following:
- Ran checkstyle and ensured checkstyle errors are seen and report is saved
- Ran mvn pmd:pmd and verified no build fail
- Ran run-coverage.sh and verified clover coverage report is saved
- Ran owasp check and verfied scan report is saved
- Verified assembly tarball is created

Please let me know if anything else is needed.

CC: @stoty
@NihalJain  could you please handle the conflicts caused due to other merges.

> @NihalJain could you please handle the conflicts caused due to other merges.

Rebased code.

@anchal246 thanks for the patch.

Nit. Could you please update the commit message as for the convention mentioned here
https://phoenix.apache.org/contributing.html

The commit message should reference the jira ticket issue (which has the format PHOENIX-{NUMBER}:{JIRA-TITLE}).

Built code locally and ran tests.:
```
mvn clean install -Dhbase.version=2.5.6-hadoop3 -DskipTests
mvn verify -Dsurefire.rerunFailingTestsCount=5 -Dhbase.version=2.5.6-hadoop3
```
FYI @chrajeshbabu , @stoty , @gjacoby126
+1 lgtm
Have you run the full Phoenix test suite with both Phoenix and Omid built with the new thirdparty, @NihalJain  ?

> Have you run the full Phoenix test suite with both Phoenix and Omid built with the new thirdparty,@NihalJain ?

Hi @stoty I have ran following for omid.

> Built code locally and ran tests.:
> 
> ```
> mvn clean install -Dhbase.version=2.5.6-hadoop3 -DskipTests
> mvn verify -Dsurefire.rerunFailingTestsCount=5 -Dhbase.version=2.5.6-hadoop3
> ```

Also had run tests for phoenix with https://github.com/apache/phoenix-thirdparty/pull/8#issuecomment-1832165125. I had done this test with omid snapshot having 3rd party change with following command:

```
mvn --batch-mode --threads=1 -Dskip.code-coverage clean verify -fae -Domid.version=1.1.1-SNAPSHOT -Dphoenix.thirdparty.version=2.0.1-SNAPSHOT  -Dsurefire.rerunFailingTestsCount=5  -Dhbase.profile=2.5
```

It's been a while let me know, if you want me to retrigger with latest changes.
No need, if you have tested with thirdparty-2.1 in both Omid and Phoenix at the same time, that's fine.
merged manually
merged manually.
This is basically what I intend commit, but it's WIP until there is no final HBase release.

> Here we need manual verification only with locally deployed cluster?

Yes, that's the only way to make sure.

The most frustrating part is that every single one of these Guava usages is completely unneccessary, this could have been done without Guava with the same effort.
But I digress.
I see there is an explicit guava dependency in omid at https://github.com/apache/phoenix-omid/blob/master/pom.xml#L1215. If it was replaced with shaded one, do we really need it?
merged manually
I think this PR also handles https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OMID-266, just FYI @stoty

> I see there is an explicit guava dependency in omid at https://github.com/apache/phoenix-omid/blob/master/pom.xml#L1215. If it was replaced with shaded one, do we really need it?

That's not a dependency, just a dependency management entry.
It's not strictly necessary, but it prevents including old Guava versions in case some dependency decides to depend on unrelocated guava.

Feel free to open a ticket for removing it, as our policy is not to manage indirect-only dependency versions.
I have successfully tested this on a pseudistributed cluster with Phoenix HEAD.
merged manually.

> +1, it also works with Phoenix 5.2.0 + HBase 2.4 profile?

Yes, it doesn't matter.
We dependecy manage every Omid transitive dependency in Phoenix.

The only thing that this really affects is the libraries in the TSO server assembly and the test environment.

Just as when we build Phoenix for HBase 2.5 but Omid is built for 2.4.
(Or when we build Phoenix with HBase 2.1 in 5.1, but Omid is built with 2.4.)
I will not commit this now, as @chrajeshbabu is in the middle of creating a release, and I don't want to interfere.

> I have successfully tested this on a pseudistributed cluster with Phoenix HEAD.

@stoty  Totally unrelated, just an fyi. We have hdfs, zookeeper and hbase (with phoenix) operators that are open source at Stackable that could potentially help you with testing environments here. Happy to spend a bit of time with you and investigate if we can come up with something to make your life easier if you are interested.

The change looks good.
I'd prefer to rename the ticket and commit to something like 
"Add additional asserts in TestOmid..."

You can always add more checks in a test, so this is more of an improvement than a fix.
@stoty thanks for the review. I have made changes as per the review comments, please review.

We do not currently have working CI for OMID.
Has the test suite passed locally @nikita15p  ?
@stoty Below is the 'mvn install' output. Build along with tests are passed
This PR can be closed as already snakeyaml is bumped up
My local build (mvn clean install) was successful.

Thank you.

In the future, please try not to add a gerrit id to the patches (I have removed it on commit)
I have merged this a long time ago, but forgot to close this PR.
This was merged a long time ago, closing the PR.
We're already at 2.0.

I'm wary of using -latest, as that has tendency to break in interesting ways when a new version is released.
CI works.
Also how do we deal with hadoop related tests if we donot use a shaded proto version here? Should we have a shaded protobuf similar to hbase?

> Also how do we deal with hadoop related tests if we donot use a shaded proto version here? Should we have a shaded protobuf similar to hbase?
